inputs.description: Send data, via TCP/IP, to AFNI running on the computer system 'sname'.  By default, uses the current system, and transfers data using shared memory.  To send on the current system using TCP/IP, use the system 'localhost'.
inputs.name: HOST

inputs.description: Tries to maintain an inter-transmit interval of 'ms' milliseconds.  The default is to send data as fast as possible.
inputs.name: DT

inputs.description: Sends data in 3D bricks.  By default, sends in 2D slices.
inputs.name: 3D

inputs.description: When using shared memory, sets the interprocess communications buffer to 'm' megabytes.  Has no effect if using TCP/IP.  Default is m=1. If you use m=0, then a 50 Kbyte buffer is used.
inputs.name: BUF

inputs.description: Swap byte pairs before sending data.
inputs.name: SWAP2

inputs.description: Send 'nz' as the value of nzz (for debugging).
inputs.name: NZFAKE

inputs.description: Send 'cmd' as a DRIVE_AFNI command; e.g., -drive 'OPEN_WINDOW A.axialimage' If cmd contains blanks, it must be in 'quotes'. Multiple -drive options may be used.
inputs.name: DRIVE

inputs.description: Send 'sss' as a NOTE to the realtime plugin. Multiple -note options may be used.
inputs.name: NOTE

inputs.description: Send value 'v' as the y-range for realtime motion estimation graphing.
inputs.name: GYR
